ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] New project
ygData.msgSnippet: I think the music is fitting for the video.  I see you finally took my advice and made some live action video to go along with it.  Now do the same thing but
ygData.messageBody:
I think the music is fitting for the video.  I see you finally took my advice and made some live action video to go along with it.  Now do the same thing but add some text narration at the bottom of the screen.  Or maybe stop frame on certain images and add graphic bubbles to show what the character might be saying.  Or hell, if you're gonna have live action, why not do character voice overs using some sound editing software?  Once you get it all together you could probably make your own animated EQ cartoon using captured video from the game.   Make maybe a 10 minute clip that shows a short battle scene, and the moments before and after it, then incorporate the music and text and voice overs and do your own little stories to perhaps journalize in animation form the events of your guild. 
 
And incidentally, the video did fade out a few seconds before the music ended on my PC.
 
Wulfric
 
 
 
 
 
----- Original Message -----
From: eq1967@...
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Saturday, February 05, 2005 4:36 PM
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] New project

The music itself was a last minute change in regards to choice.  The original music was going to be form a ManOWar compilation but I chose the Klingon Battle theme  at the last minute.  I've actually viewed the film on 4 different computers already each with a  different set up  and on all these comps the Film ends  like maybe  3 or 4 measures before the music does. And thats after I've played the film once then hit refresh..  On the first go round when the film is loading up The Vid itself ends the way I wanted it to by fading out when the music does.   
 
 
Halyburton
68 Barbarian Fateseer
Legion of Vengeance
Survivor of the Fall of FV City
Saryrn

From: Flaumigevylke

Subject: Re: [EverQuest] New project

pretty good, music was a good choice although it ended before the film did other then that nicely put together 
 
Flaumigavylke
66 Feralkin Epic'd Beastlord
Silver Tears of Flame
 
"Understand your limits, but never limit your understanding"

Thanks in advance
 
Haly
